learning_outcomes.description: Analyse and describe research designs in the Psychological literature, and to produce appropriate designs for new research.
Write and orally present critical evaluations of empirical research in Psychology, especially in terms of threats to causal inferences about observed relationships among constructs.
Understand and apply methodological techniques to enhance the sensitivity, validity and interpretability of empirical research studies.
Understand the shared aims of researchers in different areas of psychology.
To apply what you have learned about evaluating evidence to decisions in your own life.

assessments.task_description:
Tutorials are an important part of the course that will help you apply the concepts introduced in the lectures, and hone your skills of evaluating research. Therefore, it is important that you attend all tutorials. Knowledge of the lecture contents is essential for the tutorials. 

For participation in the tutorials, most students can expect to achieve 90 - 100% of the full participation marks if they study the lecture contents, read the papers for the tutorials, regularly attend and make an attempt to respond to questions and complete the exercises. Students can miss up to two tutorials without any penalty. If students miss more than two tutorials they will lose participation marks proportionally for each day they missed.

The quiz will take place during the lecture time in the specified week
assessments.task_description:
This in-class test will assess your understanding of the contents of the lectures and tutorials. The test consists mainly of short-answer questions regarding the design, results and conclusions of case studies or examples (no prior reading required). This test will be open book, which means that you can use all course materials during the assignment. No other aids are permitted (only the course materials), and each student needs to complete the test entirely on their own.

Prior to the in-class test, everyone will be offered an opportunity to complete a practice test and receive feedback on it, which optimally prepares everyone for this test.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Unless otherwise specified during the lecture, this test will be run on Blackboard, no late submissions will be accepted.
